Class RestaurantTableDAO

java.lang.Object
DataBase.dao.RestaurantTableDAO
public class RestaurantTableDAO extends Object
Data Access Object for restaurant table management.

Responsible for table inventory operations including: allocation, reservation (hold), occupation, release, and feasibility planning for seating reservations.

Supports single-table and multi-table allocation, reservation waiting logic, and planning simulations without modifying table status.

    • insertTable

      public static void insertTable(String tableId, int seats, String status) throws Exception
      Inserts or updates a restaurant table definition.

      If the table already exists, only the seat count is updated.

      Parameters:
      tableId - unique table identifier
      seats - number of seats at the table
      status - initial table status (FREE / RESERVED / OCCUPIED)
      Throws:
      Exception - on database error

      Returns:
      total free seats
      Throws:
      Exception - on query failure

      Returns:
      total number of seats across all tables
      Throws:
      Exception - on query failure

    • allocateFreeTable

      public static String allocateFreeTable(Connection conn, int numCustomers) throws Exception
      Allocates a single FREE table that can fit the given number of customers.

      Chooses the smallest suitable table (best-fit) and marks it OCCUPIED.

      Parameters:
      conn - active database connection
      numCustomers - party size
      Returns:
      allocated table id, or null if none available
      Throws:
      Exception - on database error

    • reserveFreeTableForReservation

      public static String reserveFreeTableForReservation(Connection conn, int numCustomers, int reservationId, int holdMinutes) throws Exception
      Reserves a FREE table for a reservation for a limited hold time.

      Marks the table as RESERVED and links it to the reservation id.

      Parameters:
      conn - active database connection
      numCustomers - party size
      reservationId - reservation identifier
      holdMinutes - reservation hold duration
      Returns:
      reserved table id, or null if none available
      Throws:
      Exception - on database error

    • allocateFreeTablesBestFit

      public static List<String> allocateFreeTablesBestFit(Connection conn, int reservationId, int numCustomers) throws Exception
      Allocates one or more FREE tables for a reservation at check-in time.

      First attempts a single-table allocation. If not possible, uses a best-fit DP strategy to allocate multiple tables with minimal seat waste.

      Parameters:
      conn - active database connection
      reservationId - reservation identifier
      numCustomers - party size
      Returns:
      list of allocated table ids
      Throws:
      Exception - if allocation fails (atomic operation)

    • reserveFreeTablesBestFitForReservation

      public static List<String> reserveFreeTablesBestFitForReservation(Connection conn, int reservationId, int numCustomers, int holdMinutes) throws Exception
      Reserves one or more FREE tables for a PENDING reservation.

      Uses best-fit allocation and holds the tables for a limited time window.

      Parameters:
      conn - active database connection
      reservationId - reservation identifier
      numCustomers - party size
      holdMinutes - reservation hold duration
      Returns:
      list of reserved table ids
      Throws:
      Exception - if reservation fails (atomic operation)

      Parameters:

      reservationId - reservation identifier
      Returns:

      Throws:
      Exception - on database error

      Exception

    • getTotalSeatsAvailable

      public static int getTotalSeatsAvailable(Connection conn) throws Exception
      Calculates the total number of seats currently available in the restaurant.

      This method queries the sum of seats for all tables that currently have the status 'FREE'. It uses the provided connection to execute the query.

      Parameters:
      conn - the active database connection
      Returns:
      the total count of free seats
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • sumSeatsForTables

      public static int sumSeatsForTables(Connection conn, List<String> tableIds) throws Exception
      Calculates the total seat capacity for a specific list of table IDs.

      This helper method dynamically builds a WHERE table_id IN (...) query to sum the num_of_seats for the provided tables. Returns 0 if the list is null or empty.

      Parameters:
      conn - the active database connection
      tableIds - a list of table IDs to sum
      Returns:
      the combined seat count of the specified tables
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • sumReservedSeatsForPendingReservations

      public static int sumReservedSeatsForPendingReservations(Connection conn) throws Exception
      Calculates the total number of seats currently held for pending reservations.

      This method sums the seats of tables that are marked 'RESERVED' and are linked to a reservation with status 'PENDING'. This represents capacity that is technically "taken" but not yet occupied by customers (they haven't arrived yet).

      Parameters:
      conn - the active database connection
      Returns:
      the total number of reserved seats for pending reservations
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • getAllTables

      public static List<RestaurantTableDTO> getAllTables() throws Exception
      Retrieves a complete list of all restaurant tables from the database.

      Returns a list of RestaurantTableDTO objects, including their ID, seat count, and current status (FREE, OCCUPIED, RESERVED). The list is sorted by table_id.

      Returns:
      a list of all restaurant tables
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • deleteTable

      public static boolean deleteTable(String tableId) throws Exception
      Permanently deletes a table from the database by its ID.

      Note: This method performs the raw SQL deletion. It does not check if the table is currently occupied or needed for future reservations. The isSafeToDelete(String) method should usually be called before this.

      Parameters:
      tableId - the ID of the table to delete
      Returns:
      true if the table was found and deleted; false otherwise
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • updateTableSeats

      public static boolean updateTableSeats(String tableId, int newSeats) throws Exception
      Updates the seating capacity of an existing table.

      Modifies the num_of_seats column for the specified table ID.

      Parameters:
      tableId - the ID of the table to update
      newSeats - the new number of seats
      Returns:
      true if the table was found and updated; false otherwise
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • canPackReservationsAtTime

      public static boolean canPackReservationsAtTime(Connection conn, Timestamp start, Timestamp end, int newParty) throws Exception
      POLICY 1 core: Can we pack ALL overlapping reservations + newParty into the table inventory, allowing MULTI-table per reservation, but NOT sharing a table between reservations? This does NOT touch restaurant_table.status (planning only).
      Throws:
      Exception

    • canPackReservationsAtTime

      public static boolean canPackReservationsAtTime(Timestamp start, Timestamp end, int newParty) throws Exception
      Convenience overload that opens its own connection.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • canSeatUpcomingReservationsFromFreeTables

      public static boolean canSeatUpcomingReservationsFromFreeTables(Connection conn, int lookAheadMinutes, int limitReservations) throws Exception
      Simulates whether the current inventory of FREE tables can accommodate upcoming reservations.

      This method performs a "dry run" allocation planning logic:

      1. Snapshots all currently FREE tables.
      2. Fetches the party sizes of upcoming reservations (within the look-ahead window).
      3. Iteratively attempts to match each reservation to the best-fit subset of free tables.
      If the simulation successfully finds a seat configuration for every upcoming reservation without running out of tables, it returns true. This is useful for "Safe Delete" checks or capacity planning warnings.
      Parameters:
      conn - the active database connection
      lookAheadMinutes - how many minutes into the future to scan for upcoming reservations
      limitReservations - maximum number of upcoming reservations to consider (for performance)
      Returns:
      true if all upcoming reservations can be seated with the current free tables; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • isSafeToDelete

      public static String isSafeToDelete(String tableId) throws Exception
      Checks if a table is safe to be deleted from the system.

      Performs three distinct checks: 1. Status Check: Ensures the table is currently "FREE" (not OCCUPIED or RESERVED). 2. Active Visit Check: Ensures no customers are currently seated (linked via the visit table). 3. Future Capacity Check: Ensures that removing this table will not cause overbooking for any future reservation slot where the total booked guests would exceed the new total capacity.

      Parameters:
      tableId - the ID of the table to check
      Returns:
      null if safe to delete; otherwise, a String containing the error message explaining the conflict.
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs

    • insertTableAutoId

      public static String insertTableAutoId(int seats) throws Exception
      Inserts a new table into the database with an automatically generated ID.

      This method calculates the next available ID in the sequence (e.g., T10 -> T11) by finding the current maximum numeric suffix in the 'restaurant_table' table. It is thread-safe regarding the connection pool but does not lock the table for strict serialization.

      Parameters:
      seats - the number of seats for the new table
      Returns:
      the generated table ID (e.g., "T11")
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs or generation fails
